canonical_explanation.text: Weight tells us how heavy something is. We can compare objects by holding one in each hand to feel which is heavier and which is lighter. A simple balance can also be used: the heavier side goes down and the lighter side goes up. We can order objects from lightest to heaviest.
rules: Heavier means more weight; lighter means less weight.
We compare by holding objects or using a balance.
On a balance, the heavier side goes down.
On a balance, the lighter side goes up.
We can arrange objects from lightest to heaviest.

questions.question_text: Which is heavier: a watermelon or a grape?
questions.explanation_correct: A watermelon is much heavier than a grape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A watermelon is big and heavy. A grape is tiny and light. The watermelon is heavier.

questions.question_text: Which is lighter: a feather or a brick?
questions.explanation_correct: A feather is much lighter than a brick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A feather weighs almost nothing. A brick is very heavy. The feather is lighter.

questions.question_text: Which is heavier: a school bag full of books or an empty school bag?
questions.explanation_correct: A school bag full of books is heavier because of all the books inside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Books add weight. A full bag with books is heavier than an empty bag.

questions.question_text: Which of these is heavy?
questions.explanation_correct: A big stone is heavy. Leaves, cotton balls, and paper clips are very light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Among these, only a big stone is heavy. The other objects are very light.

questions.question_text: Which of these is light?
questions.explanation_correct: A balloon is very light. You can hold it easily with one finger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A balloon is very light and can float in the air. Cars, tables, and refrigerators are all heavy.

questions.question_text: An elephant is heavier than a cat.
questions.explanation_correct: True. An elephant is much, much heavier than a cat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Elephants are one of the heaviest animals.

questions.question_text: A pencil is heavier than a bicycle.
questions.explanation_correct: False. A bicycle is much heavier than a pencil.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A bicycle is heavy and made of metal. A pencil is very light.

questions.question_text: In a balance, if one side goes down, it means that side is:
questions.explanation_correct: The side that goes down is heavier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: On a balance, the heavier side sinks down. The lighter side goes up.

questions.question_text: In a balance, if one side goes up, it means that side is:
questions.explanation_correct: The side that goes up is lighter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: On a balance, the lighter side rises up.

questions.question_text: Aarav put a mango on one side and a guava on the other side of a balance. The mango side went down. What does this tell us?
questions.explanation_correct: The mango is heavier because its side went down.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The side that goes down is heavier. So the mango is heavier than the guava.

questions.question_text: Priya holds a book in one hand and a rubber band in the other. Which hand feels heavier?

options.text: The hand with the rubber band

questions.explanation_correct: The book is heavier than the rubber band.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A book is much heavier than a rubber band. The hand with the book will feel heavier.

questions.question_text: Order from lightest to heaviest: a chair, a book, a TV
questions.explanation_correct: From lightest to heaviest: book, chair, TV.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A book is lightest, a chair is heavier, and a TV is heaviest.

questions.question_text: Which of these things is the heaviest?
questions.explanation_correct: A school desk is the heaviest among these objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A desk is made of wood or metal and is much heavier than a pencil, notebook, or eraser.

questions.question_text: Which of these things is the lightest?
questions.explanation_correct: A feather is the lightest. It weighs almost nothing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A feather is extremely light. All the other objects are much heavier.

questions.question_text: Neha has a bag of 5 apples and Kabir has 1 apple. Whose bag is heavier?
questions.explanation_correct: 5 apples are heavier than 1 apple. Neha's bag is heavier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: More apples means more weight. 5 apples weigh more than 1 apple.

questions.question_text: Order from heaviest to lightest: an ant, a dog, a cow
questions.explanation_correct: From heaviest to lightest: cow, dog, ant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cow is the heaviest, then a dog, then an ant which is very tiny and light.

questions.question_text: On a balance, a pumpkin and a tomato are placed. The pumpkin side goes down. What can we say?
questions.explanation_correct: The pumpkin side went down, so the pumpkin is heavier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The side that goes down is heavier. The pumpkin is heavier than the tomato.

questions.question_text: On a balance, both sides are at the same level. What does this mean?
questions.explanation_correct: When both sides are level, the objects weigh the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A level balance means equal weight on both sides.

questions.question_text: A football is heavier than a cricket ball.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A football is usually heavier than a cricket ball.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A football weighs about 400-450 grams while a cricket ball weighs about 160 grams.

questions.question_text: A sheet of paper is heavy.
questions.explanation_correct: False. A sheet of paper is very light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A single sheet of paper is very light and easy to pick up.

questions.question_text: A bag of rice and a bag of popcorn are the same size. Which is heavier?
questions.explanation_correct: Rice is heavier than popcorn. Even in the same size bag, rice weighs more.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice grains are dense and heavy. Popcorn is light and fluffy. The rice bag is heavier.

questions.question_text: Three fruits: a coconut, a banana, and a cherry. Order from heaviest to lightest.
questions.explanation_correct: From heaviest to lightest: coconut, banana, cherry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A coconut is the heaviest, a banana is medium, and a cherry is very light.

questions.question_text: Which animal is heavier: a hen or a horse?
questions.explanation_correct: A horse is much heavier than a hen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Horses are large animals that weigh hundreds of kilograms. Hens weigh just a few kilograms.

questions.question_text: Diya is carrying 3 books. Rehan is carrying 1 book. All books are the same. Who is carrying more weight?
questions.explanation_correct: 3 books are heavier than 1 book. Diya is carrying more weight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3 same books weigh more than 1 book. Diya carries more weight.

questions.question_text: On a balance, if the left side is up and the right side is down, the left side is heavier.
questions.explanation_correct: False. The side that is down is heavier. So the right side is heavier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. The side that goes down is heavier. The right side (which is down) is heavier.

questions.question_text: Which of these is light enough to carry in one hand?
questions.explanation_correct: A lunch box is light enough to carry in one hand.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Washing machines, cupboards, and sofas are too heavy. A lunch box is light.

questions.question_text: Arrange from lightest to heaviest: a pillow, a suitcase, a mobile phone
questions.explanation_correct: From lightest to heaviest: mobile phone, pillow, suitcase.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A mobile phone is very light, a pillow is heavier, and a packed suitcase is the heaviest.

questions.question_text: Which is lighter: a spoon or a chair?
questions.explanation_correct: A spoon is much lighter than a chair.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A spoon is small and light. A chair is big and heavy.

questions.question_text: Kavita put 5 erasers on one side of a balance and a pencil box on the other. The pencil box side went down. What can we say?

options.text: 5 erasers are heavier than the pencil box
The pencil box is heavier than 5 erasers

questions.explanation_correct: The pencil box side went down, so the pencil box is heavier than 5 erasers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The side that goes down is heavier. So the pencil box is heavier than the 5 erasers.

questions.question_text: Can you easily lift a bus?
questions.explanation_correct: No, a bus is very heavy. A person cannot lift a bus.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bus weighs many thousands of kilograms. It is much too heavy for a person to lift.

questions.question_text: Aarav has a steel plate and Meera has a plastic plate. Both are the same size. Which is likely heavier?
questions.explanation_correct: Steel is heavier than plastic. The steel plate is heavier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Steel is a heavier material than plastic. Even at the same size, steel weighs more.

questions.question_text: Four things: a truck, a bicycle, a scooter, a car. Order from lightest to heaviest.
questions.explanation_correct: From lightest to heaviest: bicycle, scooter, car, truck.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bicycle is lightest, then scooter, then car, and a truck is the heaviest.

questions.question_text: Cotton is lighter than iron.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Cotton is much lighter than iron.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Iron is a heavy metal. Cotton is soft and light.

questions.question_text: A filled water bottle is lighter than an empty water bottle.
questions.explanation_correct: False. Water adds weight. A filled bottle is heavier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Water is heavy. A filled bottle weighs more than an empty one.

questions.question_text: Ravi puts 3 oranges on one side and 3 apples on the other side of a balance. Both sides are level. What does this tell us?

options.text: Both groups weigh about the same

questions.explanation_correct: If both sides are level, both groups weigh about the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A level balance means equal weight. 3 oranges weigh about the same as 3 apples.

questions.question_text: Which is heavier: a bag of sugar or a single biscuit?
questions.explanation_correct: A bag of sugar is much heavier than a single biscuit.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bag of sugar weighs at least 1 kg. A biscuit is very light. The sugar bag is heavier.

questions.question_text: Three animals: sparrow, monkey, buffalo. Who is the heaviest?
questions.explanation_correct: A buffalo is the heaviest among sparrow, monkey, and buffalo.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A buffalo is a very large, heavy animal. It is the heaviest of the three.

questions.question_text: Which can you easily blow away?
questions.explanation_correct: A piece of cotton is so light that you can blow it away.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cotton is very light and can be blown away. Stones, books, and shoes are too heavy.

questions.question_text: If a banana balances with 4 strawberries on a simple balance, then the banana and 4 strawberries weigh the same.
questions.explanation_correct: True. If they balance, they weigh the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. When a balance is level, both sides are equal in weight.

questions.question_text: Which is lighter: an iron nail or a wooden stick (both the same size)?
questions.explanation_correct: Wood is lighter than iron. The wooden stick is lighter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Iron is heavier than wood. So the wooden stick is lighter than the iron nail.

questions.question_text: Arrange from lightest to heaviest: mango, peanut, jackfruit
questions.explanation_correct: From lightest to heaviest: peanut (very small), mango (medium), jackfruit (very big and heavy).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A peanut is tiny and light, a mango is medium, and a jackfruit is large and heavy.

questions.question_text: Which fruit is the heaviest?
questions.explanation_correct: A watermelon is the heaviest fruit among these options.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Watermelons can weigh several kilograms. Grapes, cherries, and strawberries are very small and light.

questions.question_text: Tanvi picks up a bag of cotton and a bag of sand, both the same size. Which feels heavier?
questions.explanation_correct: Sand is much heavier than cotton. The bag of sand feels heavier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sand is dense and heavy. Cotton is fluffy and light. Same-sized bags, but sand weighs much more.

questions.question_text: Rohan put an apple on one side of a balance. He keeps adding erasers to the other side until both sides are level. He used 6 erasers. What does this mean?

options.text: The apple weighs as much as 6 erasers
The apple is lighter than 1 eraser

questions.explanation_correct: When the balance is level, both sides weigh the same. So the apple weighs as much as 6 erasers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A level balance means equal weight. The apple equals 6 erasers in weight.

questions.question_text: A big balloon filled with air is heavier than a small stone.
questions.explanation_correct: False. Air is very light. Even a big balloon filled with air is lighter than a small stone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A balloon filled with air is very light. A stone, even a small one, is heavier.

questions.question_text: Which is heavier: a glass of milk or a drop of milk?
questions.explanation_correct: A glass of milk has much more milk, so it is heavier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: More milk means more weight. A full glass is much heavier than a single drop.

questions.question_text: Three school items: a geometry box, a pencil, and a school bag with books. Order from lightest to heaviest.
questions.explanation_correct: From lightest to heaviest: pencil, geometry box, school bag with books.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pencil is lightest, a geometry box is heavier, and a school bag full of books is the heaviest.

questions.question_text: A see-saw works like a balance. If Rahul (heavier) sits on one side and Ankit (lighter) sits on the other, what happens?
questions.explanation_correct: Rahul is heavier, so his side goes down. This is just like a balance.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The heavier person's side goes down on a see-saw, just like a balance.

questions.question_text: A truck is heavier than a bicycle.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A truck is much, much heavier than a bicycle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Trucks weigh thousands of kilograms while a bicycle weighs only a few kilograms.

questions.question_text: Sita has 2 rotis and her brother has 5 rotis. All rotis are the same size. Who has more weight of rotis?
questions.explanation_correct: 5 rotis weigh more than 2 rotis. Her brother has more weight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: More rotis of the same size means more weight. 5 > 2, so her brother's rotis weigh more.
